item.description:
We had an engaging Movie Night in which we shared and discussed the Transition Town Movement and sparked a conversation. At this gathering we'll continue the conversation, get to know each other and explore our common values.

This Pot Luck will be delicious if you make it so. It will also be engaging because the facilitation workgroup is hosting a Conversation Cafe. If you come to this Conversation Cafe you might be talking about the following:

    • What could happen that would enable you/us to feel fully engaged and energized about Transition?
    • If our success was completely guaranteed, what bold steps might we choose?
    • How can we support each other in taking the next steps? What unique contribution can we each make?
    • What challenges might come our way and how might we meet them?
    • What conversation, if begun today, could ripple out in a way that created new possibilities for the future of Transition?

The process will require:

Open-mindedness: Listen to and respect all points of view.
Acceptance: Suspend judgment as best you can.
Curiosity: Seek to understand rather than persuade.
Discovery: Question assumptions, look for new insights.
Sincerity: Speak from your heart and personal experience. 
Brevity: Go for honesty and depth but don’t go on and on.

Come Join in the conversation!

Original Meetup:

http://www.meetup.com/Transition-Towns-Start-ups-in-Portland/events/112313722/

 

Agenda for the evening :

5:30 Gathering

6:00 Meal time

6:30 Conversation Cafe

7:30 Debrief

7:45 Clean up

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Breaking Bread Sharing Values (or Breaking values and sharing bread)
